column2: MINNESOTA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 3. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
5. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 6. Speed limit signs are:
7. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your hands off the wheel
column6: take your eyes off the road
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 8. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 9. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column10: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
11. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 12. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.

column2: 13. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.

column2: 14. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 15. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
16. Drivers are required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
17. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 18. This sign indicates:
19. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
20. A speed restriction sign:
column4: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.
column8: must be ignored in snow conditions.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 23. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 24. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column8: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 25. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column6: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 27. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 28. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 29. When approaching a blind person walking with a white cane or guide dog, drivers should yield the right-of-way.
30. This road sign means:
31. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
32. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
33. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column6: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 34. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.

column2: 35. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
36. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.
column10: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
38. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 39. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 40. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
